attributes.action: increase the discharge period for bankruptcy to a minimum of 3 years.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the Enterprise Act (2002), since 1 April 2004, a bankruptcy in England typically lasts no longer than 12 months.  Previously the discharge period would be 2 to 3 years.

This change has resulted in individual bankruptcies reaching record levels and is predicted to increase still further.

The Enterprise Act was originally intended to encourage more start-up businesses by removing the stigma of failure and also providing a regime that allows a swifter fresh start for those who have failed. In practice though the vast majority of people who benefit from the act are individuals who borrow irresponsibly to fund a lifestyle beyond their means.
